intro: Cephalaria media, commonly known as the common cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, making it a notable ornamental plant. Cephalaria media is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
